items.sentence: I'm not even going to try to talk Tom into helping us do that.
You know that you aren't supposed to be doing that, don't you?
You didn't know that you weren't supposed to do that, did you?
You didn't know that I was supposed to do that today, did you?
You didn't know that I was still planning to do that, did you?
Did you know that we spend nearly a third of our lives asleep?
The house is very old. It needs renovating before you sell it.
All the salesmen and saleswomen are going on strike next week.
If Tom had known we needed his help, he might've come earlier.
I noticed Tom and Mary watching us with scowls on their faces.
I looked at myself in the mirror and I didn't like what I saw.
Tom lives farther from school than Mary, but closer than John.
Mary always dreamed of meeting a tall, dark, and handsome man.
Did you buy that ring yourself, or did someone give it to you?
Tom was walking in the park alone at night when he got mugged.
If I'd known that you were coming over, I'd have baked a cake.
Even though you don't like me, we still have to work together.
I think I have an answer to the question you asked me earlier.
I think that it's highly unlikely that Tom will show up today.
I wish that I could figure out how to convince Tom to help us.
